model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT. PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is not helpful in that context.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Speaker A is a librarian and loves kids, mentioning having 3 children.
Speaker B's mother was also a librarian like Speaker A.
Speaker B has a lot of kids, all grown up now and with kids of their own.
Speaker B's kids do not go to work by boat like Speaker A.
Speaker A loves playing the flute but does not do it for a living.
Speaker B asks if Speaker A plays in a band or symphony.
Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like.
Speaker B's mother was a librarian, which seems to have influenced their perspective on the job.
Speaker A and Speaker B agree on the importance of reading and the value of libraries, despite the rise of the internet.
Speaker B mentions having grandkids, implying they are older and have a family of their own.
Speaker B feels that the internet has made finding books easier for kids compared to going to a library.
Speaker A is a retired librarian who enjoys implementing creative activities in their library.
Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park.
Speaker A and Speaker B both acknowledge the decline in interest and use of libraries due to the rise of the internet.
Speaker B is aware of libraries adapting to stay relevant by adding maker spaces with tools like 3D printers.
Speaker A mentions that paper books are kept relevant by those who cherish physical copies.
Speaker A and Speaker B discuss the importance of learning new skills at any age.
Speaker A sees parents bringing in their little kids to the library as encouraging.
Speaker A has children and grandchildren, with at least one child interested in learning the flute.
Speaker B has grandkids who are more interested in phones and tablets than musical instruments.
Speaker A plans to teach their youngest child how to play the flute because she was inspired by the singer Lizzo.
Speaker B took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids.
Speaker A's other children are addicted to tablets and phones, unlike the youngest one who is interested in music.
Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.
Speaker B: Well thankfully I don't have that problem these days, I get to spend some great time with my grandkids. Have you thought any more about the idea of our annual fishing trip?  

MEMORY 1:
Speaker A is a librarian and loves kids, mentioning having 3 children. This makes Speaker A busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Consequently, Speaker B, who has a lot of kids all grown up with kids of their own, enjoys spending time with their grandkids at the park. This led Speaker B to take their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids. Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.

MEMORY 2:
User Description: Speaker B is a librarian who had a good day playing with his son's kids. He cherishes moments spent with his children and grandchildren. Speaker B's mother had the same profession as Speaker A. Speaker B has 3 grown-up children who mostly take the subway to work.

Relationship Description: Speaker B and Speaker A share a mutual understanding and agreement on the challenges and rewards of being a librarian. They discuss the importance of libraries and the decline in children's interest in reading. Speaker A is proud to teach his youngest child the flute, which Speaker B finds interesting.

Event Description: Speaker B had a great time with his son and grandkids at the park. Speaker A thought about taking his grandkids to a library, and they discussed the relevance of paper books in the digital age. Speaker A's youngest child asked to learn the flute, inspired by Lizzo. Speaker B enjoys the creative ways libraries are staying relevant and mentioned a trip to the park with his grandkids.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: MEMORY 1 is more closely aligned with the current topic of discussion, as it reflects on the shared idea of making a fishing trip an annual tradition. This is directly related to Speaker B's question about the annual fishing trip, making it more helpful and relevant to the dialogue context. MEMORY 2, on the other hand, doesn't directly relate to the current conversation about the fishing trip and instead provides broader context about Speaker B's relationship with their grandkids and libraries.

Choice: 1
